SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

transbit.tbits.common
Class PropertiesHandler

java.lang.Object
  transbit.tbits.common.PropertiesHandler

public class PropertiesHandler
extends java.lang.Object

This class encapsulates the system-specific and application-specific properties and provides methods to read(accessor methods) and change(mutator methods) them.

  • The system-specific properties are read from the Properties object obtained from System.getProperties().
  • The application-specific properties are read from the following files:
    • properties file specified through app.propFile system property passed from command-line.
    • authentication file specified through app.authFile system property passed from command-line.
    These files are searched for in APP_HOME/etc directory.

if app.authFile system property is not set, then it is assumed that the database authentication related properties are present in the file specified through app.propFile system property.

Version:
: $Id: $
Author:
: Vaibhav,Abhishek
See Also:
Configuration

getIntProperty

public static java.lang.Integer getIntProperty(java.lang.String aKey)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
This method returns the value for given key in the properties. It throws an illegal argument exception if the key is not found in the properties.

Parameters:
aKey - Key whose value is needed.
Returns:
Value for this key in the properties.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Incase the key is not found in the properties.

getProperty

public static java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String aKey)
This method returns the value for given key in the properties. It always searches in the application properties first and then in the system properties. This is to ensure that the value present in the application properties gets preference over the one in the system properties. It throws an illegal argument exception if the key is not found in the properties.

Parameters:
aKey - Key whose value is needed.
Returns:
Value for this key in the properties.
